description: The government of Denmark is enforcing a restriction of external borders: Denmark closed its borders to all but Danish citizens, individuals with Danish work or residency permits, and those the Danish government determines have a critical purpose of travel after March 14.

description: Denmark is promoting free vaccines for the over-65s and vulnerable groups under 65 (pneumococci), health workers and vulnerable groups (flu) and pregnant women (whooping cough). The goal is to reach a 75 percent sign-up rate for the pneumococci and flu vaccinations. This goes into effect on April 22.
Denmark has invested 120 million kroner (about €18 million) in antibody tests produced in China.

description: Several municipalities in Denmark invest heavily in improving cycling paths while discouraging the use of public transport to slow the spread of the virus.
Several municipalities in Denmark invest heavily in improving cycling paths while discouraging the use of public transport to slow the spread of the virus.
type_text: The policy is more intended as a recommendation not to use public transport. There is an economic factor to the policy regarding the government's investment in cycle paths, which perhaps makes it an 'economic' policy. Thus, I'm correcting the policy to 'other'.

description: Denmark is giving out new guidelines for professions with close contact with infected or potentially infected people (especially in the health and care sectors) from April 24 on. The key point is mandatory protective gear.

description: Denmark is enforcing a Quarantine on all positive-tested covid19-cases and their close contacts after Feb 28.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Denmark is ordering home quarantine for all infected people that have no or mild symptoms and are not considered particularly vulnerable are placed with daily contact from health professionals. Anybody that has been in close contact with someone who is known to be infected by SARS-CoV-2 is placed in home quarantine as well. Quarantine in those cases is enforced for 14 days. The policy was announced on 29 February 2020.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Denmark is enforcing a voluntary Quarantine on all travelers from risk areas who returned to denmark after March 2.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Denmark is recommending that all workers with non-essential work should work from home if possible after march 11.

Denmark closed all its zoos on March 18.

Denmark is enforcing a restriction of non-essential businesses after march 18: all shopping centres and stores with close contact such as hairdressers and nightclubs must be closed, restaurants can only serve take-away, and other businesses must ensure that there is enough space between customer

description: Denmark is enforcing a restriction of mass gatherings after march 11: it is recommending to cancel events with more than 100 participants.
Denmark is enforcing a restriction of mass gatherings:  It became illegal to assemble more than ten people in public after march 18.

Denmark is lowering the maximum number of people allowed to assemble, from 100 to 50, in 17 municipalities of the Copenhagen region, along with Odense municipality. This is to combat the recent rising transmission rate of COVID-19 in these places.
Denmark is enforcing Social Distancing for nursery homes, facilities for elderly people and hospitals after march 17.
